title.value: Use of deoxidized hydrochloric acid and sulfuric acid of casein whey for pigs feeding
Использование раскисленной солянокислотной и сернокислотной казеиновой сыворотки в кормлении свиней

journal.title: Zootechnical Science of Belarus : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Linkevich, S.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of farms of the Republic of Belarus developed and implemented into production zootechnical requirements to acid casein whey, selected the ways of its deoxidation, and optimized norms of its feeding of young pigs. As a result of research the following key indicators were determined: the content of the metabolizable energy – 0,74 MJ, dry matter – 64,5 g, protein – 7,4 g, fat – 0,2 g, lactose – 49,2 g, ash – 7,8 g, calcium – 1,1 g, phosphorus – 0,8 g, pH of deoxidized casein acid whey is 5,0- 5,6. The maximum storage period of deoxidized whey was determined. At a storage temperature of +20 deg C the whey pH 5,6-5,0 is retained no more than 3 days, at temperature of +5 deg C up to 7 days. In experiments on deoxidation of the whey it was determined that most efficient deoxidizer is baking soda, and the cheapest one – OPSUK. In the scientific and economic experiments with sulfuric acid casein deoxidized whey which took 10% of the nutrient value of feed mixture for piglets at fattening it was found that the average daily live weight gain in the experimental animals increased by 9,6%, with deoxidized hydrochloric acid casein whey increase energy of growth was increased by 3,3%. As a result additional notional profit per one animal amounted to 41,500 rubles when feeding with deoxidized sulfuric acid whey and 20,550 Belarusian rubles when feeding with deoxidized hydrochloric acid whey.
